paragraph_text: This table provided is a general guide to the properties of compounds containing natural and synthetic rubbers.

Most rubbers used in the manufacture of rubber hose and rubber linings contain about 60% by weight of rubber, the balance is made up of chemicals each contributing something to the physical properties of the finished product, or as an aid in processing. The selection of these components is very much a matter of compromise since the full achievement of one property is usually at the expense of another.
Excellent physical properties including abrasion and low temperature resistance. Poor resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Good weather resistance. Flame retarding. Moderate resistance to petroleum based fluids. Good physical properties.
Very good weathering resistance. Low permeability to air. Good physical properties. Poor resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Excellent resistance to petroleum based fluids. Moderate resistance to aromatics. Good physical properties.
Good physical properties including abrasion resistance. Poor resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Excellent ozone, weathering and acid resistance. Good abrasion and heat resistance. Fair resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Excellent ozone, chemical and ageing characteristics. Poor resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Excellent chemical and temperature resistance. Good resistance to petroleum based products and ozone. Poor physical properties.
Data is presented for use only as a general guide and should not be the basis for design decisions.

Hoses are used in the movement of materials like veins are to our blood, they have to work flawlessly for their life expectancy or major leaks can occur. That is why when we design a hose it is manufactured to last the test of time.

We can assure this because we have been producing quality custom hoses for over 40 years. Whether it be?our specifically designed rubbers, the high?tensile strength?reinforcing fabrics, the galvanized machine wound spring wire or the shear knowledge of producing quality specifically designed rubber hose for over 40 years, you can guarantee you will be receiving a hose that will exceed your expectations.
Material Handling hoses are used throughout an array of industries for many varying applications, from mineral sands slurry to hard rock mining and high pressure tailings lines.
Hoses can be manufactured from 12mm to 1200mm up to 10 meters long
When operating dredging machinery we know that an incorrect hose can be detrimental to the operation and life of your machinery, not to mention the costly down time to rectify the problem.

Whether your use is for expansion, contraction, deflection or just the removal of vibration through the line we can manufacture expansion and vibration joints from 25mm NB to 2500mm NB for either suction or delivery duties.

By using this system you can quickly make your own â€œspecial lengthâ€� of material handling hose, simply cut to length from our standard Abisco Material Handling Hose and CLAMP-ON  the reusable aluminum flanged Abisco Muff Coupling's and Abisco Metal spun rubber covered Gaskets.

Predominantly used in the dredging industry, floatation hoses are used for the transfer of slurry's and other materials the same as Material handling Hose but the advantage to the Floating Hose is instead of using pontoons or floatation devices to keep the hose above the water line

Long Length Heavy Duty Water Hose or â€œStacker Hoseâ€� is used thought the iron ore and coal industries for the supply of water for dust suppression. The hoses are produced with a reconstructed moulded joint so there is a continual uninterrupted hose with no couplings or metal fitting
Q&R Industrial Hoses are proud to be one of the largest manufacturers of rubber pinch valve sleeves produced in Australia.

Over the 30 plus years we have manufactured specialty items for nearly every industry and location you could think off. From Viton Lined Ship to Shore Hoses for Sulfuric Acid to water tight seals for some of the worlds leading ocean racing Maxi Yachtâ€™s.
There are many differnent contructions to be considered depending on your specific application:
All hose variations are constructed to the same high quality and standards we have become renound for over the last 30 years. With all hoses being designed with a 4:1 Saftey factor built into them.
To compliment our manufacturing facility we also stock a full range of Rubber, PVC and Composite Hoses, which includes affiliated fittings, valves and clamps.
Q&R Industrial Hoses are manufacturers of custom hand made rubber hose and rubber to metal linings to customer specifications or our recommendation.

Incorporated in 1976 family owned and operated?we are the oldest Australian owned hose manufacturer, established in supplying quality Custom Rubber Hose, Expansion joints and Pinch Valve Sleeves?throughout both Australia and the world. We pride ourselves on our quality in both construction and design.

With over 30 years experience we can design, develop, manufacture and Hydrostatic test custom rubber hoses for all industries from 25mm to 2500mm in diameter. We are committed to supplying our customers with a quality product tried and tested throughout Australia's rugged environment. Our brand name ABISCO is well known throughout the mining and quarry industries for materials handling hose and complimented by our range of ABISCO aluminium couplings and gaskets.

Over the 30 plus years we have manufactured specialty items for nearly every industry and location you could think off. From Viton Lined Ship to Shore Hoses for Sulfuric Acid to water tight seals for some of the worlds leading ocean racing Maxi Yachtâ€™s.
Q&R Industrial Hoses are manufacturers of custom hand made rubber hose and rubber to metal linings to customer specifications or our recommendation.

Incorporated in 1976 family owned and operated?we are the oldest Australian owned hose manufacturer, established in supplying Quality Custom Rubber Hose, Expansion Joints and Pinch Valves throughout both Australia and the world. We pride ourselves on our quality in both construction and design.

With over 40 years experience we can design, develop, manufacture and Hydrostatic test custom rubber hoses for all industries from 25mm to 2500mm in diameter. We are committed to supplying our customers with a quality product tried and tested throughout Australia's rugged environment.
Rubber to metal linings of tanks, pipes, impeller assemblies, screens and all other fabrications enjoy the same reputation of quality workmanship and service.
Our brand name ABISCO is well known throughout the mining and quarry industries for materials handling hose and complimented by our range of ABISCO aluminium couplings and gaskets.
We are proud to have onsite Australia's largest rubber autoclave capacity measuring 3.8mtr diameter x 9mtr long which compliments our other 4 autoclaves to offer a full range of curing capabilities.
To supplement our own product range we also supply rubber sheet and insertion, a full range of P.V.C, composite hose and affiliated fittings and clamps.
We also carry out our abrasive blasting and painting in house to assure our strict quality is adhered to.
How can we assist you today, all enquires are most welcome.
Rubber Lining provides a very versatile and durable coating which has proven to prevent the effects of corrosion, erosion and abrasion to save costly replacement of metal components.
There are a number of cheap easy to apply protective coatings available, but none can offer the endurance, chemical resistance and service life of Pressure Vulcanized Rubber Linings.

Rubber lining can be applied to a number of surfaces with a large range of compounds available which can resist most commercial solutions of chemical acids and alkalis to provide a high resistance to abrasion and temperatures. There are a number of considerations for bonding rubber such as surface preparations and the type of material to be lined. Together with this is the correct selection of rubber for the particular application bearing in mind the type of elastomer and size of component to determine the vulcanizing techniques for curing.

With Q&R Industrial Hoses having over 40 years of Rubber Lining experience you can be assured we can provide you with not only a wealth of knowledge to provide the correct compounds & lining applications, but also the experience of a combined knowledge of over 200 years of rubber liners carying out your work.
Rubber lining of tanks and vessels can be for many reasons wether it be for abrasion, corrosion or chemical we have the lining application to cover your requirements.
These items have a very high impact and abrasion application which is why it is crutial in selecting both the correct rubber compound and application to best suit your equipments environment.
With the main application for these systems being for high impact and abrasion we have over the years provided rubber lining for almost every size shape and design of Cyclone, Chutes & Hoppers.
The use of mixing impellers both integral units and separate Impeller blades and shafts are used in many applications. But one thing the majority of agitators have in common is the wear
Pipe lines, bends and reducers used mainly in the transfer of slurry materials can be a highly abrasive application. Rubber being the proven wear resistant that it is
We have been manufacturing Fishtails since our begining and in that time we have refined our design and construction to produce a superior fishtail

One of the largest of itâ€™s type 3.8 meters Diameter x 9.45 meter in length, which is quite impressive in every dimension this giant can now pressure vulcanize most processing units requiring rubber lining with far better bonding result than previously achieved with chemical, open steam curing or cold bonding.
To compliment our facility we also offer abrasive blasting and painting facilities for all applications. With our sandblasting booth measuring 4x4x8mtr
Due to the extensive applications and environments rubberlining can be used we have over the years vulcanized rubber to nearly everything you can think of and for as many reasons.

Pipe lines, bends and reducers used mainly in the transfer of slurry materials can be a highly abrasive application. Rubber being the proven wear resistant that it is, provide's a substatial extended life to your pipe lines especially in the current times with the price of steel items.

One top of the initial savings to the life of the pipe line once the rubber finally starts to wear thin the remaining rubber can be removed and re-covered to eliminate to costly price of replacing the steel items again.

The use of mixing impellers both integral units and separate Impeller blades and shafts are used in many applications. But one thing the majority of agitators have in common is the wear that the materials they are mixing are very abrasive. Therfore the application of rubber lining for wear resistance is vital in the longevity of your equipment.

We have been rubber lining agitator's / mixing impellers for over 30 years and in this time we have refined the application to a fine art and that is why Australia's best Agitator Mixing companies rely on Q&R Industrial to apply their rubber covering needs.

Due to the extensive applications and environments rubberlining can be used we have over the years vulcanized rubber to nearly everything you can think of and for as many reasons. So no matter what your request no matter how out of the square it may sound we may have already been down that path and if not we will do our absolute best to get your project up and running on time and on budget.

To compliment our facility we also offer abrasive blasting and painting facilities for all applications. With our sandblasting booth measuring 4 x 4 x 8mtr there isnt much we can't abrasive blast in house and with the majority of rubber lined items being manufactured out of steel we can provide a complete protective coating solution for your next job or project.
This table provided is a general guide to the properties of compounds containing natural and synthetic rubbers.

Most rubbers used in the manufacture of rubber hose and rubber linings contain about 60% by weight of rubber, the balance is made up of chemicals each contributing something to the physical properties of the finished product, or as an aid in processing. The selection of these components is very much a matter of compromise since the full achievement of one property is usually at the expense of another.
Excellent physical properties including abrasion and low temperature resistance. Poor resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Good weather resistance. Flame retarding. Moderate resistance to petroleum based fluids. Good physical properties.
Very good weathering resistance. Low permeability to air. Good physical properties. Poor resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Excellent resistance to petroleum based fluids. Moderate resistance to aromatics. Good physical properties.
Good physical properties including abrasion resistance. Poor resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Excellent ozone, weathering and acid resistance. Good abrasion and heat resistance. Fair resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Excellent ozone, chemical and ageing characteristics. Poor resistance to petroleum based fluids.
Excellent chemical and temperature resistance. Good resistance to petroleum based products and ozone. Poor physical properties.

We have been manufacturing Fishtails since our begining and in that time we have refined our design and construction to produce a superior fishtail, which has been proven to last the test of time throughout Australia and the world.

Over the years we have produced fishtails for many applications and varying sizes from 35mm to 550mm outlet dimensions. We can manufacture them to suit any cyclone or facility and hold many standard sizes in stock for imediate delivery.

With the main application for these systems being for high impact and abrasion we have over the years provided rubber lining for almost every size shape and design of Cyclone, Chutes & Hoppers. In this time we have refined our application to suit each individual item to help impove it's performance and longevity.

Wether it be due to the extensive studies on the various rubber compounds and hardnesses or the application even getting down to the direction of the skived joints and reduced overlap to ease the flow restrictions we have looked into it, and you know when the time comes for you to require Q&R Industrial to rubber line it we will do the best job possible to get the longest wear/life for you.
We are proud to announce we have on site an autoclave 3.8 meters Diameter x 9.45 meter in length, which is quite impressive in every dimension.

One of the largest of itâ€™s type this giant can now pressure vulcanize most processing units requiring rubber lining with far better bonding result than previously achieved with chemical, open steam curing or cold bonding.

There are a number of cheap easy to apply protective coatings available, but none can offer the endurance, chemical resistance and service life of Pressure Vulcanized Rubber Linings particularly against erosion, corrosion and abrasion.
As size is no longer a problem take full advantage of the GIANT and have your rubber lining pressure vulcanized.
To compliment our manufacturing facility we also stock a full range of Rubber, PVC and Composite Hoses, which includes affiliated fittings, valves and clamps.
Rubber lining of tanks and vessels can be for many reasons wether it be for abrasion, corrosion or chemical resistance we have the lining application to cover your requirements.

With over 30 years of rubber lining expertise we have lined almost everything conceivable wether your tanks be a small lined chrome plating nickel tank, a 12mtr long sulphuric acid transportation tanker or a 10mtr diameter holding tank to be rubber lined insitue, we have the manpower and experience to get the job done.

One of the wining factors for Q&R Industrial Hoses is our autoclave curing capacity with our 2 larger autoclaves measuring 3.8mtr diameter by 8.3mtr long and 1.2mtr diameter by 11.2mtr long we are able to autoclave cure almost anything you could require.
If we are unable to autoclave cure due to the job being insitue or to large we are able to rubberline by either open steam curing or precured cold bonded rubber.
All hose variations are constructed to the same high quality and standards we have become renound for over the last 30 years. With all hoses being designed with a 4:1 Saftey factor built into them.

Our production capabilities are constantly expanding with our current range being from 12mmNB to 1200mmNB by 10mtr long. We can also manufacture up to 2500mmNB x 2mtr long expansion and vibration joints.
Specifically designed natural or synthetic compounds to cover the large varity or requirements needed in todays processes.

Polyester fabric ply's laid on at the designed angle to suit the application. All fabric angles are cut on our Biasing Table to replicate the exact angle required each and every ply, no fabric is spiralled on as we find this an unreliable method of manufacturing.
Galvanised machine wound high tensile spring wire helix is spiralled down the hose at the required diameter and pitch for the hoses specific application if required.
UV stabilised Natural/SBR or Chemical resistant compounds depending on the application.
(For Fittings & End specifications please see Flange constructions in hose products)

We can manufacture to suit your current application or supply a new design.

There are many differnent contructions to be considered depending on your specific application all flanged ends can be built to any drillng table or custom dimensions and manufactured out of mild steel, stainless steel, titanium, aluminium or galvanised:
Rubber & Canvas (Integral Moulded for Standard Applications)
Spigot (Both Fixed & Swivel for High Pressure Applications)
Cuffed (Wire stops before the end to assist with clamping)
Expanded ends (to allow perfect flow when clamping to the outside of a pipe)

Long Length Heavy Duty Water Hose or â€œStacker Hoseâ€� is used thought the iron ore and coal industries for the supply of water for dust suppression. The hoses are produced with a reconstructed moulded joint so there is a continual uninterrupted hose with no couplings or metal fitting to interrupt the flow of the hose threw the rollers.
The hose is manufactured in 51mm, 63mm & 80mm NB and supplied with either a standard BSP fitting or to customers requirement.
To date the longest hose manufactured measured 63mmNB x 1435mtr in the one length.
All hoses once complete are hydrostatic tested and measured to ensure they adhere to the 1% elongation and radial deformation certificates.
Various Length 51mmNB & 63mmNB                       Iron Ore Stacker Tower

Predominantly used in the dredging industry, floatation hoses are used for the transfer of slurry's and other materials the same as Material handling Hose but the advantage to the Floating Hose is instead of using pontoons or floatation devices to keep the hose above the water line, which can cause fluctuations in the flow and uneven wear to the hose. The use of floating hoses allows the hoses to stay perfectly flat for an uninterrupted flow and even wear.

Used for both Suction and Discharge applications the hose construction consists of: Wear liner/tube, reinforcing layers, fully embedded machine wound galvanised spring steel wire, further reinforcement and a fabric textured rubber outer cover. Wear resistant tube of either 40 Duro or 60 Duro is supplied dependent on the application. Tube has a smooth and non-porous finish. Flow resistance is low, thereby affording the greatest possible liner lift.

By using this system you can quickly make your own â€œspecial lengthâ€� of material handling hose from our standard length of ABISCO hose, ABISCO CLAMP-ON coupling's and ABISCO Metal Spun Rubber Covered Gaskets.

You can simply cut lengths of material handling hose as required and CLAMP-ON the ABISCO couplings. This eliminates the need to try to establish beforehand from drawing or plans which hose lengths will be required.
Repair and maintenance work of installation can easily be made with the ABISCO CLAMP-ON system as any length of hose to be replaced can be cut from a standard length and the coupling are reusable.

The ABISCO CLAMP-ON system allows you to keep a very small â€œspare partâ€� in stock as you only need to keep standard lengths of hose and this quickly replenished by delivery of new standard lengths of hose.
The simplicity and versatility of the ABISCO CLAMP-ON system reduces installation time and no particular skill is required to handle the system.

In an emergency a pipe or hose in a plant can quickly be replaced with the ABISCO CLAMP-ON system. The downtime will be minimal and this can, in many cases, be the completely over-riding economical factor.

A small example of the ease with which this system can be installed is, for instance, that the couplings can be rotated around the hose before final bolting and this enables you to put the flange holes in the right position which is of particular importance when mounting a shore hose which cannot accept the radial twist.
The clamp-on couplings are quick to install and are reusable when worn hose has to be replaced. In bends and other wear spots, the hose can easily be turned, giving additional service life.
The couplings are sold in a pair of halves (for one hose end). For a joint between two hoses two such pairs of halves are required.
Bolts for clamping a pair of halves together are included.
INSTALLATION INSTURCTIONS FOR ABISCO CLAMP-ON FLANGE COUPLINGS
1. Place coupling halves in position on the hose approximately 20mm from the hose end.
2. Tighten the bolts in the coupling so the two halves have a firm grip around the hose.
3. The flange can now be used as a cutting guide. Cut the hose along the flange surface using a sharp knife or hacksaw.
4. Bend the steel wire out firmly and cut it with a hacksaw or bolt cutters. The wire should then retract into the rubber so a smooth rubber surface is formed.
5. Loosen the coupling in 5mm from the end of the hose. Tighten the flange properly and the hose is ready for installation.
6. If required, ABISCO metal spun rubber moulded gaskets can be installed between the flanges.
â€¢ ABISCO couplings are specifically designed with inside grooving to allow maximum securing to the exterior of hose.
STANDARD & HEAVY DUTY ABISCO ALUMINIUM COUPLINGS AVAILABLE TO SUIT MATERIAL HANDLING HOSE
ABISCO couplings manufactured from aluminum-magnesium type alloy possesses a high and stable combination of strength, shock resistance and ductility.

This particular allow is ideally suited for parts where dimensional stability is important. Fatigue failures of many castings have been traced to residual internal stresses and elimination of these causes of casting defects as well as the expense of heat-treating are attractive feature of this alloy.
High ductility and tensile strength makes it very suitable for shock resistant applications.
Because of the almost complete absence of heavy metals the corrosion resistance is extremely high against mild alkalis or salt spray.
Aluminum Ingots supplied for production of couplings are in accordance with Australian Standard AS1874-1988.
N.B. Couplings can also be manufactured in cast iron upon request

Whether your use is for expansion, contraction, deflection or just the removal of vibration through the line we can manufacture expansion and vibration joints from 25mm NB to 2500mm NB for either suction or delivery duties.
The Joints can be of straight hose construction or be built for large movements to include expansion/compression humps (one or multiple depending on the movement required).
They can also still entail the expansion humps while still having a smooth bore to stop the build up of contaminates and or the disruption of flow if required.
500NB, 600NB & 750NB Exp Joints for Export               700mmNB Expansion Joints
500mmNB to 400mmNB Concentric Reducer     2300mmNB Power Station Expansion Joint
600mmNB Expansion Joints for Export          450mmNB to 300mmNB Concentric Reducer
When operating dredging machinery we know that an incorrect hose can be detrimental to the operation and life of your machinery, not to mention the costly down time to rectify the problem.

That is why we design and manufacture all our hoses for there specific application, whether it be a Front Cutter Hose, Suction Hose or Delivery Hose leading off the back of the dredge each hose is constructed for its specific application.
To compliment the main hose lines on a dredge we also manufacture & retail all ancillary hoses required to keep your machinery up and running in ship shape.
Please also see our Floating Hose & Industrial Hose Australia description's in Hose Products.

Material Handling hoses are used throughout an array of industries for many varying applications, from mineral sands slurry to hard rock mining and high pressure tailings lines.
Q&R Industrial Hoses can manufacture from 12mm to 1200mm up to 10 meters long in both Material Handling (wire rienforced or Hard wall) & Material delivery (No wire rienforcing or Soft wall).

No matter what your application we can design the right hose for you, including any end combination you require from plain cut to custom designed flanges to adapt to your specific requirement. (Please see flange constructions in our hose products section).
